byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: Pres Obama's ordering of almost 300 Special Operations troops to Cameroon to aid in fight against militant group loyal to Islamic State is example of steadily expanded role troops are playing around world; Pres Obama has made exception for Special Operations forces even as he has opposed putting American troops in action, which has run counter to his stated goal of withdrawing military from countries like Afghanistan.
lead_paragraph: While President Obama has said he opposes sending Americans to fight in far-flung countries, his administration carves out exceptions for Special Operations.

headline.main: Obama’s ‘Boots on the Ground’: U.S. Special Forces Are Sent to Tackle Global Threats
headline.print_headline: Obama’s ‘Boots on the Ground’: Special Forces

snippet: While President Obama has said he opposes sending Americans to fight in far-flung countries, his administration carves out exceptions for Special Operations.
